rdf:Description.dc:title: On the Stage Coach
rdf:Description.dc:subject: American Indians
Stagecoaches
rdf:Description.dc:description: Buffalo Bill to the rescue, 4-color lithograph. The Deadwood stage became the most recognizable object in the Wild West. This scene of the stage being attacked by Indians with Buffalo Bill leading the cavalry to the rescue was replayed at every performance of the Wild West show throughout its 30-year history.
rdf:Description.dc:source: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West
Gift of The Coe Foundation
